newsitem.title: USA: IPI says principal holder in option to sell shares.
newsitem.headline: IPI says principal holder in option to sell shares.

text.p: IPI Inc parent company of Insty-Prints Inc said Friday that its principal shareholder, Jacobs Industries Inc has entered into an option agreement to sell 50 percent of its IPI holdings or about 1.6 million shares, to Marshall Financial Group Inc.
The purchase price of the option shares is $6.8 million, or $4.20 per share, the company said, adding that the option can be exercised from January 1, 1998, through January 5, 1998.

Marshall Financial is a Minneapolis-based merchant banking firm that specializes in the financial services industry. Marshall financial's president was an associate of Jacobs' principal shareholder, Irwin Jacobs.

Jacobs said in a news release that he believes Marshall Financial president Dennis Mathisen's business contacts will provide the potential to expand opportunities for IPI outside of the printing industry where IPI's resources, management and operating systems can add significant value.
IPI said it had an average of 4.7 million common shares and common share equivalents outstanding when it reported earnings for the fiscal 1997 first quarter ended February 28.
IPI shares closed Thursday at four.
